[[«حَیّاً»: مراد زنده معنوی است که شخص عاقل و اندیشمند و بیدار دل است (نگا: انعام / 122، فاطر / 22). «یَحِقَّ»: واجب شود. مسلّم گردد. «الْقَوْلُ»: فرمان عذاب. عذاب. «یَحِقَّ الْقَوْلُ»: (نگا: اسراء / 16، قصص / 63، یس / 7).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا هر کس را که زنده [دل‌] است هشدار دهد و حجت را بر کافران تمام گرداند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تا افرادی را که زنده‌اند بیم دهد (و بر کافران اتمام حجّت شود) و فرمان عذاب بر آنان مسلّم گردد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا بترساند آن را که زنده است و فرود آید سخن بر کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا بيم دهد هر كه را زنده- با فهم و خردمند يا مؤمن- باشد و آن گفتار- عذاب و هلاكت- بر كافران سزا گردد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا هر که را (از نظر فطری، عقلانی و دانایی) زنده بوده است هشدار دهد و گفته(‌ی خدا) بر (علیه) کافران محقّق گردد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So that he may warn him who is alive and feels, and justify the word against those who do not believe.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: To warn the living*, and to prove the Word against disbelievers. (Only the believers are deemed alive in Allah’s sight.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that he may warn whosoever is living, and that the Word may be realized against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In order that it may warn him who is alive, and that the sentence may be justified on the infidels.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That he or it (Muhammad SAW or the Quran) may give warning to him who is living (a healthy minded the believer), and that Word (charge) may be justified against the disbelievers (dead, as they reject the warnings).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: That he may warn whoever is alive, and prove the Word against the faithless.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that he may warn him who is alive and establish an argument against those that deny the Truth.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That he or it may give warning to him who is living, and that Word may be justified against the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: so that anyone who is alive may be warned, and that the word may come due against the faithless.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: that he may warn the living, and so that Judgement may be passed against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: by which he may warn those who are living and may let the words of God come true against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That it may warn him who would have life, and (that) the word may prove true against the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Liyunthira man kana hayyan wayahiqqa alqawlu AAala alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: to warn all who are truly alive, and to justify the word [God's verdict] against the deniers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive, and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).

verses.text: أَ وَ لَمْ‌ يَرَوْا أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُمْ‌ مِمَّا عَمِلَتْ‌ أَيْدِينَا أَنْعَاماً فَهُمْ‌ لَهَا مَالِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا ندیده اند که ما از آنچه به قدرت خود انجام داده ایم برای آنان چهارپایانی آفریده ایم که آنان مالکشان هستند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اند كه به يد قدرت خويش برايشان چارپايان را آفريديم و اكنون مالكشان هستند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا نديدند كه ما با دستان [قدرت‌] خود براى ايشان چهارپايانى آفريديم كه آنها را در اختيار دارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اند كه ما به قدرت خويش براى ايشان چهارپايانى آفريده‌ايم تا آنان مالك آنها باشند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا کافران ندیدند که بر آنها به دست (قدرت) خود از جمله آفریدگان چهارپایانی خلقت کردیم تا مالک آنها شوند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر نمی‌بینند که برخی از آن چیزهائی که قدرت ما آفریده است، چهارپایانی است که برای انسانها خلق کرده‌ایم و ایشان صاحب آنهایند؟ [[«أَوَلَمْ یَرَوْا»: (نگا: انعام / 6، رعد / 41، نحل / 48 و 79).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا نیندیشیده‌اند که ما برای آنان از آنچه دستان [قدرت‌] مان بر سازد، چارپایانی آفریده‌ایم که ایشان دارای آن هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا ندیدند که از آنچه با قدرت خود به عمل آورده‌ایم چهارپایانی برای آنان آفریدیم که آنان مالک آن هستند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا ندیدند که ما آفریدیم برای ایشان از آنچه ساخت دستهای ما چهارپایانی پس ایشانند آنها را دارندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اند كه ما از آنچه دستهاى [قدرت‌] ما [بى‌كمك آفريدگان‌] ساخته است چهارپايان را براى آنان آفريديم پس ايشان دارندگان آنهايند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و ندیدند که ما به دستاوردهای خویش برای ایشان نعمت‌هایی حیوانی آفریدیم؛ پس آنان مالک آنهایند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they not see the cattle among things We have fashioned by Our power, which they own,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Did they not see that We have created animals for them from Our handiwork, so they are their owners?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Have they not seen how that We have created for them of that Our hands wrought cattle that they own?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Observe they not that We have created for them, of that which Our hands have worked, cattle: so that they are their owners.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they not see that We have created for them of what Our Hands have created, the cattle, so that they are their owners.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have they not seen that We created for them, of Our Handiwork, livestock that they own?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they not see Our handiwork: We created for them cattle which they own?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they not see that We have created for them of what Our Hands have fashioned, the cattle, so that they are their owners.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have they not seen how We have created for them of Our handiwork the cattle, so that they are their owners,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have they not seen that We have created for them—of what Our hands have worked—cattle, so they have become their masters?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have they not seen how We have created for them the cattle they master with Our Hands?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have they not seen what We have created from the labor of Our own hands? We have given them cattle.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Do they not see that We have created cattle for them, out of what Our hands have wrought, so they are their masters?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalam yaraw anna khalaqna lahum mimma AAamilat aydeena anAAaman fahum laha malikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they not see that, among the things which Our hands have fashioned, We have created for them cattle of which they are the masters,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: See they not that it is We Who have created for them - among the things which Our hands have fashioned - cattle, which are under their dominion?-

verses.text: وَ ذَلَّلْنَاهَا لَهُمْ‌ فَمِنْهَا رَکُوبُهُمْ‌ وَ مِنْهَا يَأْکُلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و چهارپایان را برای آنان رام کردیم که برخی از آنها مرکب سواری آنان هستند و از [گوشت] برخی از آنها می خورند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنها را رامشان كرديم. بر بعضى سوار مى‌شوند و از گوشت بعضى مى‌خورند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها را برايشان رام كرديم كه هم سوارشان مى‌شوند و هم از آنها تغذيه مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنها را براى ايشان رام گردانيديم. از برخى‌شان سوارى مى‌گيرند و از بعضى مى‌خورند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن حیوانات (با عظمت و قوت) را مطیع و رام آنها ساختیم که هم بر آنها سوار شوند و هم از آنها غذا تناول کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و چهارپایان را رام ایشان ساخته‌ایم. برخی از آنها را مرکب خود می‌سازند، و از برخی دیگر تغذیه می‌کنند. [[«ذَلَّلْنَاهَا»: آنها را منقاد و رام کرده‌ایم. «رَکُوبُهُمْ»: رکوب به معنی مرکب، یعنی وسیله سواری است. فَعول به معنی مفعول، یعنی: رَکوب به معنی مَرکوب است و مانند: حَلوب به معنی محلوب.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنها را رام ایشان گردانده‌ایم، لذا هم مرکوبشان از آنهاست و هم از آن می‌خورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنها را رام ایشان ساختیم، هم مرکب آنان از آن است و هم از آن تغذیه می‌کنند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و رام کردیم آنها را برای ایشان پس از آنها است سواری ایشان و از آنها می‌خورند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنها

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آنها را برایشان رام گردانیدیم، پس از آنها سواری می‌گیرند و از همان‌ها می‌خورند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Whom We made subservient to them so that some of them they ride and some they eat?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And have subjected the animals for them, so they ride some animals and eat some?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We have subdued them to them, and some of them they ride, and some they eat;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have subdued them Unto them, so that some of them they have for riding and on some of them they feed?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We have subdued them unto them so that some of them they have for riding and some they eat.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We subdued them for them. Some they ride, and some they eat.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have subjected the cattle to them so that some of them they ride and eat the flesh of others.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We have subdued them unto them so that some of them they have for riding and some they eat.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have for riding, some for food?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We made them tractable for them; so some of them make their mounts and some of them they eat.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have subdued these to them, and some of them they ride and some of them they eat;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have made the cattle subservient to them so they ride and consume them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We have subjected them to them, so some of them they have to ride upon, and some of them they eat.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wathallalnaha lahum faminha rakoobuhum waminha yakuloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have subjected these to them, so that some may be used for riding and some for food,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And that We have subjected them to their (use)? of them some do carry them and some they eat:

verses.text: وَ لَهُمْ‌ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ‌ وَ مَشَارِبُ‌ أَ فَلاَ يَشْکُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و برای آنان در آن چهارپایان سودهایی [چون پشم، کُرک و پوست] و نوشیدنی هایی [چون شیر و فرآورده های آن] هست؛ آیا سپاس گزاری نمی کنند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ايشان را در آنها سودهاست و آشاميدنيها. چرا سپاس نمى‌گويند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از آنها بهره‌ها و نوشيدنى‌ها دارند. پس چرا شكر نمى‌گزارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از آنها سودها و نوشيدنيها دارند. پس چرا شكرگزار نيستيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و برای آنها در آن حیوانات منافع (بسیاری از پوست و پشم و کرک و غیره) و آشامیدنی‌های فراوان (از شیر و ماست و روغن و غیره) هست، آیا شکر (این نعمتها را) نباید به جای آرند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و از برخی از آنها استفاده‌هائی می‌کنند و (از پشم و کرک و مو و پوست و استخوانشان فایده‌ها می‌برند، و از شیر برخی) از آنها نوشیدنیها و فرآورده‌های شیری به دست می‌آورند. آیا نباید شکرگزار (این همه نعمت خدا) باشند؟ [[«مَشَارِبُ»: جمع مَشْرَب به معنی مشروب؛ مانند مَأْکل به معنی مَأْکُول؛ نوشیدنیها. مراد شیرها است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای آنان در آنها سودها و آشامیدنی‌هاست، آیا سپاس نمی‌گزارند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای آنان بهره‌های دیگری در آن (حیوانات) است و نوشیدنیهائی گوارا؛ آیا با این حال شکرگزاری نمی‌کنند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برای ایشان است در آنها سودهائی و آبشخورها (نوشابه‌هائی) پس آیا سپاسی نگزارند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان را در آنها سودهايى است- از پوست و پشم و كود آنها- و آشاميدنيهايى- از شيرشان-. آيا سپاس نمى‌گزارند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برایشان در آن‌ها سودها و نوشیدنی‌هاست. پس آیا سپاس نمی‌گزارند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And they derive other advantages and drinks from them. Even then they do not offer thanks,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And for them in the animals are numerous different benefits and drinks; so will they not be grateful?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: other uses also they have in them, and beverages. What, will they not be thankful?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they have therefrom other benefits and drinks. Will they not then give thanks?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they have (other) benefits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink, will they not then be grateful?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they have in them other benefits, and drinks. Will they not give thanks?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They derive a variety of benefits and drinks from them. Will they, then, not give thanks?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they have (other) benefits from them, and (they get to) drink. Will they not then be grateful

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Benefits and (divers) drinks have they from them. Will they not then give thanks?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There are other benefits for them therein, and drinks. Will they not then give thanks?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they also have other uses in them and drinks. What, will they not give thanks!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: From cattle they get milk and other benefits. Will they not then give thanks?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And therein they have advantages and drinks; will they not then be grateful?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walahum feeha manafiAAu wamasharibu afala yashkuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: some for milk to drink and some from which other benefits may be received? Will they not be grateful?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they have (other) profits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful?

verses.text: وَ اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ آلِهَةً لَعَلَّهُمْ‌ يُنْصَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به جای خدا معبودانی انتخاب کرده اند به امید اینکه [به وسیله آنها] یاری شوند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به جاى اللّه خدايانى اختيار كردند، بدان اميد كه ياريشان كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به جاى خدا معبودانى گرفتند به اميد آن كه يارى داده شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و غير از خدا[ى يگانه‌] خدايانى به پرستش گرفتند، تا مگر يارى شوند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (مشرکان از جهل) به جای خدا خدایانی دیگر اتخاذ کردند تا مگر (از جانب آنها) یاری شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان گذشته از خدا، معبودهائی برای خود برگزیده‌اند، بدین امید که (از سوی ایشان) یاری شوند. [[«مِن دُونِ»: غیر از. بجز.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به جای خداوند خدایانی را [به پرستش‌] گرفته‌اند به امید آنکه ایشان یاری یابند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنان غیر از خدا معبودانی برای خویش برگزیدند به این امید که یاری شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بگرفتند جز خدا خدایانی شاید یاری شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به جاى خداى يكتا خدايانى گرفتند بدان اميد كه يارى شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و غیر از خدا(یِ یگانه) خدایانی (به پرستش) برگرفتند، تا شاید (به وسیله‌ی آنان) یاری شوند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And take other gods apart from God that they may perhaps give them help.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they have appointed Gods other than Allah, that perhaps they may be helped!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Yet they have taken, apart from God, gods; haply they might be helped.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they have taken beside Allah gods, hoping that haply they may be succoured.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they have taken besides Allah aliha (gods), hoping that they might be helped (by those so called gods).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Yet they have taken to themselves gods other than God, that perhaps they may be helped.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They set up deities apart from Allah, hoping that they will receive help from them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they have taken besides Allah, gods, hoping that they might be helped.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they may be helped.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They have taken gods besides Allah, [hoping] that they might be helped [by the fake deities].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And yet they have taken gods, other than Allah, so that they might helped!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They chose idols besides God in the hope of receiving help from them, but they will not be able to help them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they have taken gods besides Allah that they may be helped.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waittakhathoo min dooni Allahi alihatan laAAallahum yunsaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They have set up other gods besides God, hoping to be helped by them,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Yet they take (for worship) gods other than Allah, (hoping) that they might be helped!

verses.text: لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌ نَصْرَهُمْ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ جُنْدٌ مُحْضَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که [معبودان،] قدرت یاری دادن به آنان را ندارند و آنان [که سبک مغزان روی برتافته از حق اند] برای آن معبودان [از سوی شیطان] سپاهی احضار شده اند [تا عمر و مالشان را فدای این معبودان باطل کنند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها را ياراى آن نيست كه به ياريشان برخيزند، ولى اينان همانند سپاهى به خدمتشان آماده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [ولى اين معبودان‌] نمى‌توانند آنها را يارى كنند، و اينان براى آنها سپاهى احضار شده‌اند [كه با هم به دوزخ در خواهند آمد]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [ولى بتان‌] نمى‌توانند آنان را يارى كنند و آنانند كه براى [بتان‌] چون سپاهى احضار شده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هرگز آن خدایان کمترین نصرتی به آنها نتوانند کرد و خود این مشرکان معبودانشان را سپاهی حاضر خدمت هستند که همگی را (در قیامت در آتش دوزخ) حاضر آرند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: معبودها (ی دروغین) نمی‌توانند پرستندگان خود را کمک کنند و یاری دهند، و بلکه پرستندگان، سپاههای آماده‌ی معبودها (ی عاجز خود) هستند (و از آنها مواظبت می‌نمایند و از بلاها و گزندها به دور می‌دارند). [[«لا یَسْتَطِیعُونَ»: معبودها نمی‌توانند (نگا: اعراف / 192، یونس / 18). «جُندٌ»: سپاه. لشکر. «مُحْضَرُونَ»: آماده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [اما] آنها به یاری [دادن‌] ایشان توانایی ندارند، و ایشان برای آنها چون سپاهی هستند که در [عرصه قیامت‌] حاضر کرده شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی آنها قادر به یاری ایشان نیستند، و این (عبادت‌کنندگان در قیامت) لشکری برای آنها خواهند بود که در آتش دوزخ احضار می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نتوانندشان یاری کردن و ایشانند آنان را لشکری فراخواندگان (احضارشدگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [و حال آنكه آن بتان‌] يارى‌كردن ايشان نتوانند و آنان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (ولی آن بتان) نمی‌توانند آنان را یاری کنند، حال آنکه اینان (چون) سپاهی برایشان (در نگهبانیشان) احضارشدگانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will not be able to help them and will be brought (to Us) as their levied troops.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They (the appointed Gods) cannot help them; and they and their armies will come (to Us), as captives.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They cannot help them, though they be hosts made ready for them.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They are not able to give them succour; whereas they shall be against them host brought forward.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They cannot help them, but they will be brought forward as a troop against those who worshipped them (at the time of Reckoning).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They cannot help them, although they are arrayed as troops for them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Those deities can render them no help. Yet these devotees act as though they were an army in waiting for them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They cannot help them, but they will be brought forward as a troop (against those who worshipped them).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers) are unto them a host in arms.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [But] they cannot help them, while they [themselves] are an army mobilized for their defence.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They cannot help them, for them (the socalled) army are brought (with them to Hell).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Instead, the disbelievers will be brought into the presence of God as the soldiers of the idols.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (But) they shall not be able to assist them, and they shall be a host brought up before them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yastateeAAoona nasrahum wahum lahum jundun muhdaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but they are not able to help them: rather they will be brought before God as their allied host.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).

verses.text: فَلاَ يَحْزُنْکَ‌ قَوْلُهُمْ‌ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ‌ مَا يُسِرُّونَ‌ وَ مَا يُعْلِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس گفتارشان تو را اندوهگین نکند، بی تردید ما آنچه را پنهان می دارند و آنچه را آشکار می کنند، می دانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سخنشان تو را اندوهگين نسازد. ما هر چه را پنهان مى‌دارند يا آشكار مى‌سازند مى‌دانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس گفتار آنها تو را محزون نكند. قطعا ما آنچه را پنهان مى‌دارند و آنچه را آشكار مى‌سازند مى‌دانيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، گفتار آنان تو را غمگين نگرداند كه ما آنچه را پنهان و آنچه را آشكار مى‌كنند، مى‌دانيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس سخن این مشرکان تو را محزون نکند. ما هر آنچه پنهان و آشکار گویند همه را می‌دانیم (و به کیفر کفرشان می‌رسانیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس (حالا که چنین است) سخنان آنان تو را غمگین نکند، ما می‌دانیم آنچه را که مخفی می‌دارند و آنچه را که آشکار می‌سازند. [[«قَوْلُهُمْ»: مراد سخنان مبنی بر الحاد و انکار خدا، و تکذیب و تقبیح پیغمبر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس سخنشان تو را اندوهگین نکند، ما آنچه پنهان می‌دارند و آنچه آشکار می‌دارند می‌دانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس سخنانشان تو را غمگین نسازد، ما آنچه را پنهان می‌دارند و آنچه را آشکار می‌کنند می‌دانیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اندوهگین نسازدت سخن ایشان همانا دانیم آنچه را نهان دارند و آنچه پدیدار کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس سخن آنان تو را اندوهگين نكند، همانا ما آنچه را پنهان مى‌دارند و آنچه را آشكار مى‌كنند مى‌دانيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، گفتار آنان تو را غمگین نگرداند (زیرا) ما آنچه را پنهان می‌دارند و آنچه را آشکار می‌کنند، می‌دانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So be not grieved by what they say. We certainly know what they hide and disclose.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) do not grieve because of what they (the disbelievers) say; indeed We know what they conceal and what they disclose.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So do not let their saying grieve thee; assuredly We know what they keep secret and what they publish.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So let not their speech grieve thee. Verily We! We know whatsoever they keep secret and whatsoever they make known.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So let not their speech, then, grieve you (O Muhammad SAW). Verily, We know what they conceal and what they reveal.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So let their words not sadden you. We know what they conceal, and what they reveal.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Let not their words grieve you. Surely We know all things about them, what they conceal and what they reveal.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, let not their speech then grieve you. Verily, We know what they conceal and what they reveal.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So let not their speech grieve thee (O Muhammad). Lo! We know what they conceal and what proclaim.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do not let their remarks grieve you. We indeed know whatever they hide and whatever they disclose.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So do not let their sayings grieve you. Surely, We have knowledge of what they hide and all that they reveal.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Muhammad, let not their words annoy you. We certainly know whatever they conceal or reveal.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore let not their speech grieve you; surely We know what they do in secret and what they do openly.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala yahzunka qawluhum inna naAAlamu ma yusirroona wama yuAAlinoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Let not their words grieve you. We have knowledge of all that they conceal and all that they reveal.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Let not their speech, then, grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose.

verses.text: أَ وَ لَمْ‌ يَرَ الْإِنْسَانُ‌ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ‌ مِنْ‌ نُطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ‌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا انسان ندانسته که ما او را از نطفه ای [پست و ناچیز] آفریده ایم و اینک ستیزه گری آشکار است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آدمى كه اكنون خصمى آشكار است، نمى‌داند كه او را از نطفه‌اى آفريده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا اين انسان نمى‌داند كه او را از نطفه‌اى آفريديم كه هم اكنون دشمنى آشكار شده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر آدمى ندانسته است كه ما او را از نطفه‌اى آفريده‌ايم، پس بناگاه وى ستيزه‌جويى آشكار شده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا انسان ندید که ما او را از نطفه ناقابل (چنین آراسته) خلقت کردیم؟ آن گاه (به جای آنکه شکر گزار باشد) دشمن آشکار ما گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا انسان (با چشم عقل و دیده‌ی بینش ننگریسته است و) ندیده است که ما او را از نطفه‌ی ناچیزی آفریده‌ایم و هم اینک او پرخاشگری است که آشکارا به پرخاش برمی‌خیزد؟! (زهی بی‌خبری و خیره‌سری!). [[«أَوَلَمْ یَرَ؟»: (نگا: انعام / 6، رعد / 41، نحل / 48 و 79). «خَصِیمٌ مُبِینٌ»: (نگا: نحل / 4).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا انسان نیندیشیده است که ما او را از نطفه‌ای آفریده‌ایم، آنگاه او جدل‌پیشه‌ای آشکار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا انسان نمی‌داند که ما او را از نطفه‌ای بی‌ارزش آفریدیم؟! و او (چنان صاحب قدرت و شعور و نطق شد که) به مخاصمه آشکار (با ما) برخاست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا ندیده است انسان که ما آفریدیمش از چکّه آبی پس ناگهان او است دشمنی یا ستیزه‌جوئی (آشکار)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آدمى نديده- ندانسته- است كه ما او را از نطفه‌اى آفريديم، كه اكنون ستيزه‌گرى- يا دشمنى- آشكار است؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و مگر آدمی ندیده است که ما او را به‌راستی از نطفه‌ای آفریدیم. پس به ناگاه وی ستیزه‌گری آشکارگر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Does not man see We created him from a drop of semen? Even then he becomes an open contender,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And did not man see that We have created him from a drop of semen? Yet he is an open quarreller!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Has not man regarded how that We created him of a sperm-drop? Then lo, he is a manifest adversary.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beholdest not man that We have created him from a sperm? Yet lo! he is a manifest disputer?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah (mixed male and female discharge semen drops). Yet behold! He (stands forth) as an open opponent.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Does the human being not consider that We created him from a seed? Yet he becomes a fierce adversary.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Does man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah. Yet behold he (stands forth) as an open opponent.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed? Yet lo! he is an open opponent.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Does not man see that We created him from a drop of [seminal] fluid, and, behold, he is an open contender!?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Has the human not seen how We created him from a drop (of sperm)? Yet he is a clear opponent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Has the human being not considered that We have created him from a drop of fluid. He is openly quarrelsome.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Does not man see that We have created him from the small seed? Then lo! he is an open disputant.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalam yara alinsanu anna khalaqnahu min nutfatin faitha huwa khaseemun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Does not man see that We created him from a drop. Yet there he is, flagrantly contentious,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!

verses.text: وَ ضَرَبَ‌ لَنَا مَثَلاً وَ نَسِيَ‌ خَلْقَهُ‌ قَالَ‌ مَنْ‌ يُحْيِي‌ الْعِظَامَ‌ وَ هِيَ‌ رَمِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که آفرینش نخستین خود را از یاد برده برای ما مثلی زد [و] گفت: چه کسی این استخوان ها را در حالی که پوسیده اند، زنده می کند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در حالى كه آفرينش خود را از ياد برده است، براى ما مثَل مى‌زند كه چه كسى اين استخوانهاى پوسيده را زنده مى‌كند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و براى ما مثلى آورد و آفرينش خود را فراموش كرد، گفت: چه كسى استخوان‌ها را كه چنين پوسيده است زنده مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و براى ما مَثَلى آورد و آفرينش خود را فراموش كرد؛ گفت: «چه كسى اين استخوانها را كه چنين پوسيده است زندگى مى‌بخشد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و برای ما مثلی (جاهلانه) زد و آفرینش خود را فراموش کرد، گفت: این استخوانهای پوسیده را باز که زنده می‌کند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برای ما مثالی می‌زند و آفرینش خود را (از خاک) فراموش می‌کند و می‌گوید: چه کسی می‌تواند این استخوانهائی را که پوسیده و فرسوده‌اند زنده گرداند؟! [[«الْعِظَامَ»: جمع عَظْم، استخوانها. «رَمِیمٌ»: پوسیده و فرسوده. «نَسِیَ خَلْقَهُ»: جمله کوتاهی است که پاسخ کاملی برای پرسش هر فرد بی‌خبری است که قدرت خدا را با قدرت مردم همسان بداند و درباره آفرینش خود از خاک نیندیشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای ما مثل می‌زند و آفرینش خود را فراموش می‌کند، گوید چه کسی استخوانها را -در حالی که پوسیده‌انداز نو زنده می‌گرداند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای ما مثالی زد و آفرینش خود را فراموش کرد و گفت: «چه کسی این استخوانها را زنده می‌کند در حالی که پوسیده است؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بزد برای ما مثَلی و فراموش کرد آفرینش خود را گفت کیست که زنده کند استخوانها را حالی که آنهایند خاکی پوسیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و براى ما مَثَلى زد- در زنده‌كردن مردگان- و آفرينش خود را فراموش كرده گفت: كيست كه استخوانها را در حالى كه پوسيده و خاك شده زنده مى‌كند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برای ما مَثَلی زد- حال آنکه آفرینش خود را فراموش کرد. - گفت: «چه کسی این استخوان‌ها را در حالی‌که (پوسیده و) خاکستر شده‌اند زنده می‌کند؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And applies comparisons to Us, having forgotten his origin, and says: "Who can put life into decayed bones?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And he invents an example for Us, while forgetting his own creation, saying, “Who is such that can revive the bones when they have completely rotted away?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he has struck for Us a similitude and forgotten his creation; he says, 'Who shall quicken the bones when they are decayed?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he propoundeth for us a similitude, and forgetteth his creation, He saith: who shall quicken the bones when they are decayed?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he puts forth for Us a parable, and forgets his own creation. He says: "Who will give life to these bones when they have rotted away and became dust?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And he produces arguments against Us, and he forgets his own creation. He says, “Who will revive the bones when they have decayed?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He strikes for Us a similitude and forgot his own creation. He says: “Who will quicken the bones when they have decayed?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he puts forth for Us a parable, and forgets his own creation. He says: "Who will give life to these bones after they are rotten and have become dust"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the fact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when they have rotted away?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He draws comparisons for Us, and forgets his own creation. He says, ‘Who shall revive the bones when they have decayed?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And he has struck for Us a parable, and forgotten his own creation. He asks: 'Who will quicken the bones after they have decayed'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He questions Our Resurrection of him, but has forgotten his own creation. He has said, "Who will give life to the bones which have become ashes?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he strikes out a likeness for Us and forgets his own creation. Says he: Who will give life to the bones when they are rotten?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wadaraba lana mathalan wanasiya khalqahu qala man yuhyee alAAithama wahiya rameemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: producing arguments against Us, and forgetting his own creation. He asks, "Who can give life back to bones after they have rotted away?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And he makes comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (origin and) Creation: He says, "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?"

verses.text: قُلْ‌ يُحْيِيهَا الَّذِي‌ أَنْشَأَهَا أَوَّلَ‌ مَرَّةٍ وَ هُوَ بِکُلِ‌ خَلْقٍ‌ عَلِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: همان کسی که نخستین بار آن را پدید آورد. زنده اش می کند، و او به هر چیزی داناست

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: كسى آنها را زنده مى‌كند كه در آغاز بيافريده است، و او به هر آفرينشى داناست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: همان كسى كه نخستين بار آن را آفريد زنده‌اش مى‌كند، و او به هر گونه آفرينشى آگاه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «همان كسى كه نخستين‌بار آن را پديد آورد و اوست كه به هر [گونه‌] آفرينشى داناست.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: آن خدایی زنده می‌کند که اول بار آنها را ایجاد کرد و او به هر آفریده‌ای داناست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: کسی آنها را زنده می‌گرداند که آنها را نخستین بار (از نیستی به هستی آورده است و آنها را بدون الگو و مدل) آفریده است، و او بس آگاه از (احوال و اوضاع و چگونگی و ویژگی) همه‌ی آفریدگان است. [[«أَنشَأَهَا»: آنها را آفرید و پدیدار کرد (نگا: انعام / 98، عنکبوت / 20). «هُوَ بِکُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِیمٌ»: خدا بسیار آگاه از اعمال و اقوال هر مخلوقی است. خدا هر نوع آفرینشی را بسیار خوب می‌داند، و در بازآفرینی کسی در نمی‌ماند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو همان کسی که نخستین‌بار آن را پدید آورده است، زنده‌اش می‌گرداند، او به هر آفرینشی دانا [و توانا]ست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «همان کسی آن را زنده می‌کند که نخستین بار آن را آفرید؛ و او به هر مخلوقی داناست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو زنده کند آنها را آنکه پدید آورد یا بیافرید آنها را نخستین بار و او است به هر آفرینشی دانا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: همان [خداى‌] كه نخستين بار آفريدش زنده‌اش مى‌كند، و او به همه آفرينش- يا آفريدگان- داناست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: « همان کس که نخستین بار آنها را - بدون سابقه‌- پدید آورد، آنها را زنده می‌کند و اوست که به هر (گونه) آفرینشی بسی داناست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "He who created you the first time. He has knowledge of every creation,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “They will be revived by the One Who created them the first time; and He is the All Knowing of every creation.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'He shall quicken them, who originated them the first time; He knows all creation,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou:" He shall quicken them Who brought them forth for the first time, and He is of every kind of creation the Knower!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: (O Muhammad SAW) "He will give life to them Who created them for the first time! And He is the All-Knower of every creation!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “He who initiated them in the first instance will revive them. He has knowledge of every creation.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “He Who first brought them into being will quicken them; He knows well about every kind of creation;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "He will give life to them Who created them for the first time! And He is the All-Knower of every creation!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: He will revive them Who produced them at the first, for He is Knower of every creation,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘He will revive them who produced them the first time, and He has knowledge of all creation.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'He will quicken them who originated them the first time; He has knowledge of every creation;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell him, "He who gave them life in the first place will bring them back to life again. He has the best knowledge of all creatures.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: He will give life to them Who brought them into existence at first, and He is cognizant of all creation

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul yuhyeeha allathee anshaaha awwala marratin wahuwa bikulli khalqin AAaleemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "He who brought them into being in the first instance will give them life again: He has knowledge of every type of creation:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say, "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-

verses.text: الَّذِي‌ جَعَلَ‌ لَکُمْ‌ مِنَ‌ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَاراً فَإِذَا أَنْتُمْ‌ مِنْهُ‌ تُوقِدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همان کسی که برای شما از درخت سبز، «آتش زنه» آفرید، که اکنون شما از آن آتش می افروزید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن خدايى كه از درخت سبز برايتان آتش پديد آورد و شما از آن آتش مى‌افروزيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان [خدايى‌] كه برايتان از درخت سبز آتش آفريد و به ناگاه شما از آن آتش مى‌افروزيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همو كه برايتان در درخت سبزفام اخگر نهاد كه از آن [چون نيازتان افتد] آتش مى‌افروزيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن خدایی که از درخت سبز و تر برای انتفاع شما آتش قرار داده که (برای حاجتی که خواهید) بر می‌افروزید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن کسی که از درخت سبز، برای شما آتش بیافریده است، و شما با آن، آتش روشن می‌کنید. (او که قادر بر رستاخیز انرژیها است، قادر بر برانگیختن مردگان و بازگرداندن به زندگی دوباره‌ی ایشان است). [[«الشَّجَرِ الأخْضَرِ»: درخت سبز. این تعبیر بیانگر این واقعیّت است که تنها درختان سبز و زنده می‌توانند عمل کربن‌گیری و ذخیره‌کردن نور آفتاب را انجام دهند. «نَاراً»: مراد انرژی ذخیره شده آفتاب بر اثر فتوسنتز در چوبهای درختان است که بر اثر اصطکاک و مالش، به صورت جرقّه الکتریسیته ظاهر می‌شود و باعث روشن شدن آتش می‌گردد، یا با سوزاندن چوبها، انرژی نهان در آنها آزاد می‌شود، و نور و حرارت اندوخته و پنهان در ذرّات پیکره درختان، دیگر بار به صورت روشنائی و گرما جلوه‌گر می‌آید (نگا: تفسیر نمونه. تفسیر المنتخب). «تُوقِدُونَ»: آتش را برمی‌افروزید. از مصدر ایقاد، به معنی افروختن آتش.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان کسی که برای شما از درخت سبز[تر و تازه‌] آتشی پدید آورد، که آنگاه از آن آتش می‌افروزید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان کسی که برای شما از درخت سبز، آتش آفرید و شما بوسیله آن، آتش می‌افروزید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنکه نهاد برای شما از درخت سبز آتشی که ناگهان شمائید از آن فروزندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همان [خداى‌] كه براى شما از درخت سبز آتشى پديد كرد پس آنگاه شما از آن آتش مى‌افروزيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسی که برایتان از درخت سبزفام اخگری نهاد، که از آن ناگهان (آتشی‌) می‌افروزید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who gave you fire from a green tree, with which you ignite the flame."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “The One Who has created for you fire from the green tree, so you kindle from it.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who has made for you out of the green tree fire and lo, from it you kindle.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who giveth you out of the green tree fire, and lo! ye kindle therewith.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He, Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! You kindle therewith.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He who produced fuel for you from the green trees, with which you kindle a fire.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He Who created from a green tree a fire for you, a fire to light your stoves with.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold you kindle therewith.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Who hath appointed for you fire from the green tree, and behold! ye kindle from it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He, who made for you fire out of the green tree, and, behold, you light fire from it!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who has made fire for you from the green tree with which you kindle'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He has created fire for you out of the green tree from which you can kindle other fires.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He Who has made for you the fire (to burn) from the green tree, so that with it you kindle (fire).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allathee jaAAala lakum mina alshshajari alakhdari naran faitha antum minhu tooqidoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He who produces fire for you from green trees and from this you kindle fire."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! ye kindle therewith (your own fires)!

verses.text: أَ وَ لَيْسَ‌ الَّذِي‌ خَلَقَ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضَ‌ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَى‌ أَنْ‌ يَخْلُقَ‌ مِثْلَهُمْ‌ بَلَى‌ وَ هُوَ الْخَلاَّقُ‌ الْعَلِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا کسی که آسمان ها و زمین را آفریده است، قدرت ندارد که [پس از مرگشان] همانند آنان را بیافریند؟ چرا قدرت دارد؛ زیرا اوست که آفریننده بسیار داناست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا كسى كه آسمانها و زمين را آفريده است نمى‌تواند همانندشان را بيافريند؟ آرى مى‌تواند، كه او آفريننده‌اى داناست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا كسى كه آسمان‌ها و زمين را آفريده قادر نيست كه مانند ايشان را بيافريند؟ چرا، و او آفريدگار آگاه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا كسى كه آسمانها و زمين را آفريده توانا نيست كه [باز] مانند آنها را بيافريند؟ آرى، اوست آفريننده دانا.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آن خدایی که (خلقت با عظمت) آسمانها و زمین را آفریده بر آفرینش (موجود ضعیفی) مانند این کافران قادر نیست (که چون مردند باز آنها را زنده گرداند)؟ چرا (البته قادر است) و او آفریننده و داناست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا کسی که آسمانها و زمین را آفریده است، قدرت ندارد (انسانهای خاک شده را دوباره) به گونه‌ی خودشان بیافریند؟ آری! (می‌تواند چنین کند) چرا که او آفریدگار بس آگاه و دانا است. [[«أَن یَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُمْ»: این که به گونه سابق و به شکل پیشین بسازد و بیافریند. «الْخَلاّق»: صیغه مبالغه خالق است. آفریدگار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا کسی که آسمانها و زمین را آفریده است، توانای آن نیست که مانند ایشان را بیافریند، چرا، و او آفرینشگر داناست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا کسی که آسمانها و زمین را آفرید، نمی‌تواند همانند آنان [= انسانهای خاک شده‌] را بیافریند؟! آری (می‌تواند)، و او آفریدگار داناست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نیست آنکه آفرید آسمانها و زمین را توانا بر آنکه بیافرد مانند ایشان را بلی و او است آفریننده دانا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آن كه آسمانها و زمين را آفريد بر آفريدن مانند اينها توانا نيست؟ چرا [تواناست‌]، و اوست آفريدگار دانا.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و کسی که آسمان‌ها و زمین را آفریده توانا نیست که (باز) مانند آنها را بیافریند؟ آری، اوست بسیار آفریننده‌ی بس دانا.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: How can He who created the heavens and the earth not be able to create others like them? Why not? He is the real creator all-knowing.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And is it not possible for the One Who created the heavens and the earth to create the likes of them? It is surely possible, why not? And He is the Great Creator, the All Knowing of everything.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Is not He, who created the heavens and earth, able to create the like of them? Yes indeed; He is the All-creator, the All-knowing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of these? Yea! He is the Supreme Creator, the Knower.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is not He, Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Yes, indeed! He is the All-Knowing Supreme Creator.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Certainly. He is the Supreme All-Knowing Creator.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Has He Who created the heavens and the earth no power to create the likes of them? Yes, indeed, He is the Superb Creator.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth, able to create the like of them Yes, indeed! He is the All-Knowing Supreme Creator.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Aye, that He is! for He is the All-Wise Creator,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yes indeed! He is the All-creator, the All-knowing.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Is He who created the heavens and the earth unable to create their like? Yes, indeed, He is the Creator, the Knower.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is the One who has created the heavens and the earth not able to create another creature like the human being? He certainly has the power to do so. He is the Supreme Creator and is All-knowing.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yea! and He is the Creator (of all), the Knower.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalaysa allathee khalaqa alssamawati waalarda biqadirin AAala an yakhluqa mithlahum bala wahuwa alkhallaqu alAAaleemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is He who created the heavens and earth not able to create others like these people? Of course He is! He is indeed the Supreme Creator, the All Knowing:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" - Yea, indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme, of skill and knowledge (infinite)!

verses.text: إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُ‌ إِذَا أَرَادَ شَيْئاً أَنْ‌ يَقُولَ‌ لَهُ‌ کُنْ‌ فَيَکُونُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شأن او این است که چون پدید آمدن چیزی را اراده کند، فقط به آن می گوید: باش، پس بی درنگ موجود می شود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون بخواهد چيزى را بيافريند، فرمانش اين است كه مى‌گويد: موجود شو، پس موجود مى‌شود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرمان او هرگاه چيزى را اراده كند، تنها اين است كه به آن بگويد: باش، پس مى‌شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چون به چيزى اراده فرمايد، كارش اين بس كه مى‌گويد: «باش»؛ پس [بى‌درنگ‌] موجود مى‌شود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرمان نافذ او چون اراده خلقت چیزی کند به محض اینکه گوید: «موجود باش» بلا فاصله موجود خواهد شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هر گاه خدا چیزی را بخواهد که بشود، کار او تنها این است که خطاب بدان بگوید: بشو! و آن هم می‌شود. [[«أَمْرُهُ»: کارش. (نگا: بقره / 109، یوسف / 21). فرمانش (نگا: نحل / 40، انبیاء / 27، حجّ / 65).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: امر او چون [آفرینش‌] چیزی را اراده کند، تنها همین است که به آن می‌گوید موجود شو، [و بی‌درنگ‌] موجود می‌شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمان او چنین است که هرگاه چیزی را اراده کند، تنها به آن می‌گوید: «موجود باش!»، آن نیز بی‌درنگ موجود می‌شود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز این نیست کار او گاهی که چیزی خواهد که بدو گوید بشو پس بشود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه كار و فرمان او، چون چيزى را بخواهد، اين است كه گويدش: باش، پس مى‌باشد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هنگامی که چیزی را اراده فرماید، کارش این بس که می‌گوید: «شو‌»، پس (بی‌درنگ) می‌شود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When He wills a thing He has only to say: "Be," and it is.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And His only task when He intends a thing is to command it, “Be” – and it thereupon happens!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: His command, when He desires a thing, is to say to it 'Be,' and it is.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: His affair, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith Unto it: be, and it becometh.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, His Command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be!" and it is!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: His command, when He wills a thing, is to say to it, “Be,” and it comes to be.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Whenever He wills a thing, He just commands it “Be” and it is.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, His command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be!" -- and it is!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith unto it: Be! and it is.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: All His command, when He wills something, is to say to it ‘Be,’ and it is.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When He wills a thing, His command is to say to it 'Be', and it is!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Whenever He decides to create something He has only to say, "Exist," and it comes into existence.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: His command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it: Be, so it is.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innama amruhu itha arada shayan an yaqoola lahu kun fayakoonu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when He decrees a thing, He need only say, "Be!" and it is.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily, when He intends a thing, His Command is, "be", and it is!

verses.text: فَسُبْحَانَ‌ الَّذِي‌ بِيَدِهِ‌ مَلَکُوتُ‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ وَ إِلَيْهِ‌ تُرْجَعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بنابراین [از هر عیب و نقصی] منزّه است خدایی که مالکیّت و فرمانروایی همه چیز به دست اوست، و به سوی او بازگردانده می شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: منزه است آن خدايى كه ملكوت هر چيزى به دست اوست و همه به سوى او باز گردانده مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس منزه است خدايى كه مالكيت و حاكميت هر چيزى به دست اوست و به سوى او بازگردانده مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [شكوهمند و] پاك است آن كسى كه ملكوت هر چيزى در دست اوست، و به سوى اوست كه بازگردانيده مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس منزه و پاک است خدایی که (ملک و) ملکوت هر موجود به دست (قدرت) او و بازگشت شما همه خلایق به سوی اوست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پاکا خداوندی که مالکیّت و حاکمیّت همه چیز در دست او است. و شما به سوی او برگردانده می‌شوید (و به حساب و کتابتان رسیدگی می‌گردد). [[«مَلَکُوتُ»: مالکیّت و حاکمیّت. کشور عظیم. قدرت تصرّف فراوان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس منزه است کسی که ملکوت هر چیز به دست اوست و به سوی او باز گردانده می‌شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس منزّه است خداوندی که مالکیّت و حاکمیّت همه چیز در دست اوست؛ و شما را به سوی او بازمی‌گردانند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس منزّه است آنکه به دستش پادشاهیهای همه چیز است و بسوی او بازگردانیده شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس پاك و منزه است آن [خداى‌] كه پادشاهى- مالكيت و حاكميت- همه چيز به دست اوست و به سوى او بازگردانيده مى‌شويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس منزه است آن کسی که ملکوت (و واقعیت کلی) هر چیزی در دست (علم وقدرت و رحمت) اوست. و تنها سوی او بازگردانیده می‌شوید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So all glory to Him who holds all power over everything, to whom you will go back in the end.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore Purity is to Him in Whose Hand* is the control over all things and it is towards Him that you will be returned. (Used as a metaphor to mean Power).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So glory be to Him, in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and unto whom you shall be returned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore hallowed be He in whose hand is the governance of everything, and Unto whom ye shall be returned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So Glorified is He and Exalted above all that they associate with Him, and in Whose Hands is the dominion of all things, and to Him you shall be returned.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So glory be to Him in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him you will be returned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Holy is He Who has full control over everything, and to Him you shall all be recalled.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So glorified be He and exalted (above all that they associate with Him), and in Whose Hand is the dominion of all things, and to Him you shall be returned.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor Glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all things! Unto Him ye will be brought back.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So immaculate is He in whose hand is the dominion of all things, and to whom you shall be brought back.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Exaltations to Him in whose Hand is the Kingdom of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All glory belongs to the One in whose hands is the control of all things. To Him you will all return.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore glory be to Him in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things, and to Him you shall be brought back.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasubhana allathee biyadihi malakootu kulli shayin wailayhi turjaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So glory be to Him who has control over all things. It is to Him that you will all be brought back.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.
